item.title: Ron paul, 2012
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:30, topic:394817”]The USA saved all of Europe’s ass twice. We didn’t have to join WWI at all, and only did so because we got tired of Germany sinking british ships with Americans on them (Lusitania). We also didn’t have to do anything with Europe in WWII, as you said, the only one who attacked us is Japan, we could have just dealt with them and left you guys alone. There is also all of the policing NATO has forced us to do for Europe, like all of the crap that went down in former Yugoslavia all those years.

All told the USA has spent countless lives and money in or for Europe over the years, and answer me this, has Europe ever helped the USA at all? The last time I can even think of European troops being in North America, was when Britain failed at taking back the USA during the war of 1812, and that wasn’t exactly helping the USA, was it?[/quote]

The British Empire was defending the Seas between you, the Germans and the Japanese empire. Of course, not solely - but with the biggest navy in the world, the loss of that would have put the United States at increased risk. The same can be said for the French, a navy that also rivaled the British, German and US navy were also there.

It seems to me that you’re forgetting it was the financial ruin of Europe after WW2 that allowed the United States to become the big dominant superpower it is now, so it you cant think about it as if it is the same US as it is now, you certainly didn’t have the military then that you have now. Of course, it would have taken over eventually anyway, but the war accelerated it very fast, eliminating pretty much all competition. With Britain the only ones were in the way of the Germans taking over Western Europe and the Russians in the East, it wouldn’t have been a great time to be American if they had decided to turn their focus to the US if Britain hadn’t successfully defended against the invasion attempts.

The United States involvement in the war looked minuscule in comparison to the Russian involvement, without the Russians, even with the help of the United States - it would have been much, much harder, and possibly even a loss. At the time (and shortly after the war), the Russians were also seen as the biggest ally of various Western European nations. A survey in Britain asking who they thought Britain’s best ally was, put Russia at the top - it was only afterwards that the “Special relationship” was popularised, with increased focus on similarities in culture and the US aid to Britain in the form of a loan, and continually, British aid most of your wars.

Everyone is thankful for the help brought by the US, but the over importance some people put on US involvement and the way you word some things which looks like you’re discrediting the millions of troops who were fighting from the start, Canada, New Zealand, Australia, France, Russia, Britain and shortly after, the Netherlands, is quite insulting.

As for Europe helping USA, helping you various wars you have started since isn’t good enough? Sure, no one has been over in the US defending from an invading enemy, but that is because the country has never experienced that. But you can bet we and various other European countries would be over there in the event of an invasion, regardless of how well equipped you are.

Read full topic

There is also all of the policing NATO has forced us to do for Europe, like all of the crap that went down in former Yugoslavia all those years.

item.title: Ron paul, 2012
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:37, topic:394817”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=491997.msg3600711#msg3600711 date=1305522219]

In other words, “your country is totally better in all ways for some reason”.

Yes, mostly any north/west European country is better than US.

Ha! Sure they are, unless you need saved from some other crazy European country, twice. Or if you need policing of some genocide done, or if you want someone to enforce a no-fly zone over Lebanon. Then you can only actually count on one country to help out, and I don’t know why they still do honestly. We should just go back to USA pre-WWI and let you guys deal with your own problems…
[/quote]And this is exactly why America sucks dick. We should just let people deal with their own problems.[/quote]
And then watch them whine? Like it happened just last month?
“Americans need to get out of other countries business, like Iraq and Afghanistan, and just mind their own business!”
2 seconds later
“People in Lebanon are being killed unjustly, why is the USA taking so long to get in there and stop this injustice!!!”

Read full topic

item.title: Ron paul, 2012
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:32, topic:394817”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=491997.msg3600923#msg3600923 date=1305560983]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=491997.msg3600922#msg3600922 date=1305560764]

In other words, “your country is totally better in all ways for some reason”.

Yes, mostly any north/west European country is better than US.

Ha! Sure they are, unless you need saved from some other crazy European country, twice. Or if you need policing of some genocide done, or if you want someone to enforce a no-fly zone over Lebanon. Then you can only actually count on one country to help out, and I don’t know why they still do honestly. We should just go back to USA pre-WWI and let you guys deal with your own problems…

The only reason US joined WWI and WWII was after being provoked. We should thank the Japanese, if they had let pearl harbor be alone, US would just watch Hitler gain power in Europe. OK maybe they would do something, but that would only be because they would see Hitler as a treat.

Name a single event where US did something for Europe, without gaining something themselves (Marshall Plan does not count).
[/quote]All told the USA has spent countless lives and money in or for Europe over the years, and answer me this, has Europe ever helped the USA at all? The last time I can even think of European troops being in North America, was when Britain failed at taking back the USA during the war of 1812, and that wasn’t exactly helping the USA, was it?
[/quote]Every single war you have participated in for the past 50 years have been unjustified and as such does not warrant any help.

I’m assuming you are talking about the current Afghanistan and Iraq war though. Saddam Hussein in Iraq should have been overthrown years ago, but his people couldn’t do it, so we helped them out.[/quote]You armed him in the first place, and he was a dictator back then already. Why have you not taken down other oppressive leaders around the world, far worse than Saddam was?

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:32, topic:394817”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=491997.msg3600923#msg3600923 date=1305560983]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=491997.msg3600922#msg3600922 date=1305560764]

In other words, “your country is totally better in all ways for some reason”.

Yes, mostly any north/west European country is better than US.

Ha! Sure they are, unless you need saved from some other crazy European country, twice. Or if you need policing of some genocide done, or if you want someone to enforce a no-fly zone over Lebanon. Then you can only actually count on one country to help out, and I don’t know why they still do honestly. We should just go back to USA pre-WWI and let you guys deal with your own problems…

The only reason US joined WWI and WWII was after being provoked. We should thank the Japanese, if they had let pearl harbor be alone, US would just watch Hitler gain power in Europe. OK maybe they would do something, but that would only be because they would see Hitler as a treat.

Name a single event where US did something for Europe, without gaining something themselves (Marshall Plan does not count).
[/quote]All told the USA has spent countless lives and money in or for Europe over the years, and answer me this, has Europe ever helped the USA at all? The last time I can even think of European troops being in North America, was when Britain failed at taking back the USA during the war of 1812, and that wasn’t exactly helping the USA, was it?
[/quote]Every single war you have participated in for the past 50 years have been unjustified and as such does not warrant any help.

Afghanistan was basically being ran by a terrorist organization that attacked the USA, so that was fully justified too.[/quote]Afganistan was ran by the Taliban, not Al Quaida. Your entire reason for occupying the country was to destroy a terrorist organization (which you can’t destroy in the first place), remove the government, enforce democracy and then leave. Newsflash: You’re still there.

I was also thinking about the Vietnam war, biggest joke in history.

Read full topic

Ha! Sure they are, unless you need saved from some other crazy European country, twice. Or if you need policing of some genocide done, or if you want someone to enforce a no-fly zone over Lebanon. Then you can only actually count on one country to help out, and I don’t know why they still do honestly. We should just go back to USA pre-WWI and let you guys deal with your own problems…

The only reason US joined WWI and WWII was after being provoked. We should thank the Japanese, if they had let pearl harbor be alone, US would just watch Hitler gain power in Europe. OK maybe they would do something, but that would only be because they would see Hitler as a treat.

Again it wasn’t really our business, but we helped out less fortunate people who were getting murdered by the thousands at no advantage to us, only a large cost of life and money. Afghanistan was basically being ran by a terrorist organization that attacked the USA, so that was fully justified too.

The USA saved all of Europe’s ass twice. We didn’t have to join WWI at all, and only did so because we got tired of Germany sinking british ships with Americans on them (Lusitania). item.title: Ron paul, 2012
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:21, topic:394817”]At my current job, back when they were not unionized, the starting salary for my position was $27/hr and many people were making $36/hr+
When Bell bought them, they went unionized and the starting salary for my position is now $14.20 and it’s capped at $18/hr. so until I get promoted from a temp, it sucks =/

now THAT is a shitty union.[/quote]

That’s quite a backwards union. Here, unions are there to make sure the situation for the workers improves constantly. Of course, this doesn’t mean that salary’s rise with huge amounts every year, but the minimum is inflation correction. In rare occasions the wages are frozen for a year, for instance when a large company is almost bankrupt and needs to reorganize heavily. Unions don’t take that, but also understand that when they demand that no jobs are lost, the company goes bankrupt.

Read full topic

item.title: Ron paul, 2012
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:15, topic:394817”]@Yakman, unions are basically useless though, or at least the ones I’ve had experience with.

One example is when I worked at a large supermarket called Meijer (think walmart, just in the midwest instead of all over). We had a union, and the only thing they did the entire 4 years I worked there was negotiate to lower every hourly worker’s wages by about $1 an hour. What a great union!

Bottom line, all current unions are useless.[/quote]

At my current job, back when they were not unionized, the starting salary for my position was $27/hr and many people were making $36/hr+
When Bell bought them, they went unionized and the starting salary for my position is now $14.20 and it’s capped at $18/hr. so until I get promoted from a temp, it sucks =/

now THAT is a shitty union.

Read full topic
